title: Guideline
text:
These are engineering- or experiment-based submissions. We look for:

Problem-solving projects that address a clear niche (e.g., “A Low-Cost Mesh Network for Campus Emergency Alerts”).
Failure analyses and negative results that include data and lessons learned.
Reproducibility: documentation, materials, and files sufficient for others to reproduce the work.

title: Guideline
text:
These are engineering- or experiment-based submissions. We look for:

Problem-solving projects that address a clear niche (e.g., “A Low-Cost Mesh Network for Campus Emergency Alerts”).
Failure analyses and negative results that include data and lessons learned.
Reproducibility: documentation, materials, and files sufficient for others to reproduce the work.

title: Guideline
text:
Theories
For theoretical work, focus on clear exposition of the idea, motivation, and implications. We welcome conceptual advances even without experimental validation; include illustrative calculations, simulations, or suggested tests when possible.

title: Guideline
text:
Other accepted formats
For other accepted genre, we feel we do not have anything to add, but if you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us

title: Guideline
text:
Submission guidance

Expectations: suggest target lengths (e.g., short notes 500–1500 words; full articles 2,000–6,000 words) and whether a submission will undergo peer review.
Reproducibility: include data, code, and a short README or runnable notebook when relevant.
Formats: we accept QMD/Markdown, LaTeX/PDF manuscripts, figures, and supplementary archives. For software or data, include a stable repository link (e.g., GitHub, Zenodo) and a license.

title: Empowering Student Research
text:
SCIE Campus
  
  
    
     contact@kyanos.pub
  

      


Kyanos is more than a journal; it is a bridge between classroom learning and professional inquiry. We provide a platform for students to step out of the prescribed curriculum and into the role of the investigator.
Whether you are deciphering complex fluid dynamics or building your first neural network, we want to see your process.
Submission Guildeline Submit Your Work

title: Empowering Student Research
text:
Kyanos is more than a journal; it is a bridge between classroom learning and professional inquiry. We provide a platform for students to step out of the prescribed curriculum and into the role of the investigator.
Whether you are deciphering complex fluid dynamics or building your first neural network, we want to see your process.
Submission Guildeline Submit Your Work

title: Empowering Student Research
text:
What We Publish
We accept a diverse range of submissions across Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics, and Computer Science.


Pure & Theoretical Inquiry


Formal Research Full-length papers that adhere to academic rigorous standards and peer-review logic.


Theoretical Sketches Ideas that push beyond IGCSE/A-Level/IB boundaries—mathematically-driven physics is highly encouraged.


Mathematical Modelling The application of abstract mathematics to solve real-world or theoretical problems.




Applied Science & Engineering


Experimental Reports Carefully designed lab experiments that test a hypothesis or verify a phenomenon.


Engineering Projects Hardware prototypes, structural designs, or physical solutions to modern challenges.


Short Insights Focused research highlights that provide a singular, high-impact realization.




Digital & Computational Frontiers


Software & Programming Code-based projects, algorithm development, or innovative software tools.


The “Open” Category Have a unique interdisciplinary project? If it involves research or application, we want to see it.

title: Empowering Student Research
text:
Join a Global Community
Kyanos brings together emerging investigators across campuses and borders. We don’t just publish papers; we foster a culture of collaborative learning and intellectual curiosity.
Ready to share your story?
Get in touch with the Editorial Team

title: 基于 ESP32 的校园微型气象站
text: 解决学校气象数据不透明的问题，为户外社团提供参考。

title: 基于 ESP32 的校园微型气象站
text: 解决学校气象数据不透明的问题，为户外社团提供参考。

title: 基于 ESP32 的校园微型气象站
text:
失败分析 (Critical Analysis)
在第一版原型中，我们使用了廉价的 DHT11 传感器，但在高湿度环境下（>80%）数据完全漂移。最终我们更换为 BME280。

title: 基于 ESP32 的校园微型气象站
